title-group.article-title: THE FIFTEEN THEOREM FOR UNIVERSAL HERMITIAN LATTICES OVER IMAGINARY QUADRATIC FIELDS

abstract.p: We will introduce a method to get all universal Hermitian lattices over imaginary quadratic fields $Q(\sqrt { - m} )$ for all m. For each imaginary quadratic field $Q(\sqrt { - m} )$ , we obtain a criterion on universality of Hermitian lattices: if a Hermitian lattice L represents 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 10, 13, 14 and 15, then L is universal. We call this the fifteen theorem for universal Hermitian lattices. Note that the difference between Conway-Schneeberger's fifteen theorem and ours is the number 13. In addition, we determine the minimal rank of universal Hermitian lattices for all imaginary quadratic fields.
